did.unittitle:
Iwo Jima photo album and map
1945-1946
did.langmaterial: The material is in English; some items in Japanese.
did.abstract: Jack D. Cheesman, a resident of Ann Arbor, Mich., served in the V Amphibious Corps of the U.S. Marine Corps during the World War II. He fought in the Battle of Iwo Jima between February 19-March 26, 1945. The collection consists of photographs of American soldiers, a bound photograph album from Japanese island of Iwo Jima from 1945, a Japanese map of Iwo Jima, and some correspondence in Japanese with an enclosed photograph. The album includes photographs taken by Marine Corps photographer Douglas H. Page that were compiled into a photo album by Cheesman, entitled "Iwo Jima." The album has been scanned and is available online.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The photo album was donated by Thomas Cheesman (Donor no 10974) in August 2013; additional accession came in 2014.

accruals.p: No further additions to the records are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open without restriction.

userestrict.p: The images are in the public domain.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Jack D. Cheesman papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Jack D. Cheesman, a resident of Ann Arbor, Mich., served in the V Amphibious Corps of the U.S. Marine Corps during the World War II. Cheesman served between February 1943 and January 1946 and finished the war in the rank of Corporal. He fought in the Battle of Iwo Jima between February 19-March 26, 1945.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of photographs of American soldiers, a bound photograph album from Japanese island of Iwo Jima from 1945, a Japanese map of Iwo Jima, and some letters in Japanese with an enclosed photograph. The photo album includes photographs taken by Marine Corps photographer Douglas H. Page that were compiled into a photo album by Cheesman, entitled "Iwo Jima." The album has been scanned and is available online. Loose photographs include portraits of Cheesman, group photos in front and inside of military buildings, military camps, and in teh field. Miscellaneous items include Japanese art, a few newspaper clippings, and Cheesman's military ID.
